Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can accurately identify and illustrate two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can draw at least three different kinds of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, lizards, or fish.
The student can show the differences in the types of living things that exist in each habitat.
The student can illustrate patterns in the diversity of plants and animals across the two habitats.
The student can organize the drawing clearly to represent and compare the variety of life in each habitat.
